response:
Ipsilateral left-leg spastic weakness with hyperreflexia and Babinski, preserved arms and cranial nerves, positive Romberg and predominant lower-limb dorsal column involvement with contralateral pain changes on the body indicate a Brown-Sequard–type hemicord syndrome at thoracic level, sparing brain and upper limbs.

lesion_locations = ["left thoracic spinal cord"]
